list_definition.definition: the fixed bodies in the sky, which are really distant suns

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The Sun is a star, and the Earth is one of its planets.

list_definition.definition: any of the bodies in the sky appearing as points of light

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The sky was full of stars.

list_definition.mean_english: vật hình sao, trang trí ngôi sao
list_definition.definition: an object, shape or figure with a number of pointed rays, usually five or six, often used as a means of marking quality etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The teacher stuck a gold star on the child’s neat exercise book

list_definition.definition: a leading actor or actress or other well-known performer eg in sport etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: (also adjective) She has had many star roles in films.

list_definition.definition: to play a leading role in a play, film etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She has starred in two recent films.

list_definition.definition: (of a film etc) to have (a certain actor etc) as its leading performer
a juicy, yellow, oblong, tropical fruit, which, when cut across, is star-shaped.
